title: Trump May Cancel NASA's Giant Moon Rocket: What It Would Mean For Elon Musk
content: Since Donald Trumps recent electoral victory, rumours and speculation have circulated that Nasas giant Moon rocket, the Space Launch System (SLS), could be under threat.

title: Dressing The Church: One Of Rome's Last Clergyman Tailors

title: Bill Gates "Laboratory" Remark On India Revives 2009 Vaccine Trials

title: No Lawyer For Hindu Priest In Bangladesh, Next Bail Hearing After A Month
content: The bail hearing of Chinmoy Krishna Das Brahmachari, the Hindu priest arrested and accused of sedition in Bangladesh, has been pushed to next month after no lawyer appeared in court for the hearing on Tuesday.
summary: The bail hearing of Chinmoy Krishna Das Brahmachari, the Hindu priest arrested and accused of sedition in Bangladesh, has been pushed to next month after no lawyer appeared in court for the hearing on Tuesday.

title: US Lawmakers Back Covid Chinese Lab Leak Theory After Two-Year Probe
content: US lawmakers concluded a two-year investigation Monday into the Covid-19 outbreak that killed 1.1 million Americans -- backing the theory that the virus likely leaked from a Chinese laboratory.
summary: US lawmakers concluded a two-year investigation Monday into the Covid-19 outbreak that killed 1.1 million Americans -- backing the theory that the virus likely leaked from a Chinese laboratory.

title: Who Is Aliya Fakhri, Nargis Fakhri's Sister Arrested For Killing Ex Boyfriend
content: Aliya Fakhri, sister of actor Nargis Fakhri, was arrested for allegedly murdering her ex-boyfriend and his friend in Queens by setting a two-story garage on fire. The court has remanded her and her next appearance is scheduled for December 9.
summary: Aliya Fakhri, sister of actor Nargis Fakhri, was arrested for allegedly murdering her ex-boyfriend and his friend in Queens by setting a two-story garage on fire. The court has remanded her and her next appearance is scheduled for December 9.

title: Ban On Indian TV Channels Sought In Bangladesh High Court
content: A writ petition has been filed in the Bangladesh High Court seeking a ban on the broadcast of Indian TV channels in the country citing growing concerns over the impact of Indian media on Bangladeshi culture and society, Dhaka Tribune reported.
summary: A writ petition has been filed in the Bangladesh High Court seeking a ban on the broadcast of Indian TV channels in the country citing growing concerns over the impact of Indian media on Bangladeshi culture and society, Dhaka Tribune reported.

title: Apple Accused Of Silencing Workers, Spying On Personal Devices In US Lawsuit

title: White House Defends Biden's Hunter Pardon Amid Criticism
